results.title: Drugs, Sex, Baby Oil: The ‘Freak-Offs’ at the Core of Sean Combs’s Troubles
results.abstract: Prosecutors say the sexual encounters in hotel rooms were coercive and abusive and are the heart of their sex trafficking case. The music mogul’s lawyers call them consensual.
results.byline: By Ben Sisario and Julia Jacobs

multimedia.caption: The government’s sex trafficking and racketeering conspiracy case against Sean Combs focuses on sexual encounters he arranged at hotels.
The government’s sex trafficking and racketeering conspiracy case against Sean Combs focuses on sexual encounters he arranged at hotels.

results.abstract: “Indra’s Net,” coming to the Park Avenue Armory, shows off the polymathic Monk’s artistry as she enters her 60th season as a performer and creator.
results.byline: By Joshua Barone and Balarama Heller

results.title: Kelsey Grammer Analyzes 40 Years of Frasier: ‘I Have Nothing to Regret’
results.abstract: The actor has been playing the snobby psychiatrist off and on since 1984 and has no plans to stop. He thinks the current “Frasier” reboot “could last another decade.”

multimedia.caption: Kelsey Grammer has never really been able to shake his signature character, but he is OK with that. “It’s wonderful to spend your lifetime entertaining people,” he said.
multimedia.copyright: Caroline Tompkins for The New York Times

results.title: Kathryn Crosby, Actress and Bing Crosby’s Widow, Dies at 90

results.title: For the Children of Architects, Filmmaking as Therapy
results.abstract: Jim Venturi shines a light on his parents, the postmodern innovators Robert Venturi and Denise Scott Brown. How architects’ hidden lives are often revealed by kids.

results.title: Billy Edd Wheeler, Songwriter Who Celebrated Rural Life, Dies at 91
results.abstract: His plain-spoken songs were recorded by Elvis Presley, Kenny Rogers and many others. The duo of Johnny Cash and June Carter made his “Jackson” a huge country hit.

results.title: Nelson DeMille, Blockbuster Author Who Thrilled Millions, Dies at 81
results.abstract: In best seller after best seller, world-weary investigators tackled military malfeasance and Russian spies, cracking jokes and beers to the delight of legions of devoted fans.

multimedia.caption: Mr. DeMille in 2005 at his home in Garden City, N.Y. His book-lined office, which he called Area 51, was filled with the scent of Marlboro cigarettes, black coffee and pencil shavings.

results.title: On an Italian Island, a Home That Celebrates Color and Craft
results.abstract: Atop the volcanic cliffs on the tranquil Salina, one woman has created a respite where art and nature reside in perfect harmony.
results.byline: By Nancy Hass and Diego Mayon

multimedia.caption: In Cecilia Morelli’s compound on the Aeolian island of Salina, the walls of her daughter, Gaia’s, playroom were hand-painted by Pictalab — a group of Milanese artisans who visited the home for two weeks to decorate many of its surfaces — in a scallop pattern meant to evoke waves. The toile sconces are from G Lab in Milan, and the carpet is from Jaipur Rugs.

In Cecilia Morelli’s compound on the Aeolian island of Salina, the walls of her daughter, Gaia’s, playroom were hand-painted by Pictalab — a group of Milanese artisans who visited the home for two weeks to decorate many of its surfaces — in a scallop pattern meant to evoke waves. The toile sconces are from G Lab in Milan, and the carpet is from Jaipur Rugs.

The toile sconces are from G Lab in Milan, and the carpet is from Jaipur Rugs.
